uniEmo.name: uni-emo

license.description: A short and permissive license, allowing for free use, modification, and distribution, including for commercial purposes.

wordOrder.default: Order by importance (most important information first)

languageSpecific.description: Mode available to respect specific language order

question.wholeQuestion: Place at the beginning of the sentence
question.partialQuestion: Place immediately after the relevant part

timeExpression.usage: Place immediately before the emoji indicating time

emojiCombination.description: Combine multiple emojis to express new concepts
principles: Order emojis by importance, with the most crucial concept first
Use 2-3 emojis typically, maximum 5 for complex concepts
Prioritize culturally neutral emojis for universal understanding
Express abstract concepts using related concrete objects or actions
Add emotional nuance as needed, based on importance
Use country flags to specify cultural context when necessary

complexStructures.description: Expression of more complex sentence structures

examples.concession: 🌧️☔ 🆚 👤🙋 🚶‍♂️🏙️ (Even if it rains, I will go out)

examples.reason: 🛣️❄️ ∴ 👤🙋 🚗🐢 (Because the road is icy, I drive carefully)

guidelines: Consider cultural differences and choose universally understandable expressions
Use country flags to specify cultural context when necessary
Continuously evaluate new combinations and expressions, adding to the dictionary as necessary
futureConsiderations: Create educational tools for learning uni-emo
Establish a community-driven platform for uni-emo development
Explore integration with existing communication platforms
